definition: to put on display/to be on show/to exhibit
to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: The Qing dynasty vases had been displayed on the window sill for years.
sentences.chinese: 這些清代花瓶已經在展臺上展出了很長時間。

sentences.english: It was on show at the International Tokyo Toy Show.
sentences.chinese: 它曾在東京國際玩具展中展出。

sentences.english: The slideshows listed below are for your viewing pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 下面展出的幻燈片或視頻是讓您看着高興的。

sentences.english: But they are showing what will be all the rage next year.
sentences.chinese: 但他們展出的是一些明年要流行的時裝。

sentences.english: Exhibitors were eager to speak with participants and hear what they had to say.
sentences.chinese: 展出商渴望着與參會者交談，並傾聽他們想要說什麼。

sentences.english: Han Jia, are there any of the tools used by the builders among in the exhibits?
sentences.chinese: 韓佳，這裏有沒有展出修渠勇士們使用的工具啊？

sentences.english: A system of roads radiates from the town centre.
sentences.chinese: 一組道路從市中心向四面八方伸展出去。

sentences.english: Professor Jones exhibited all of the items he uncovered during his last expedition.
sentences.chinese: 瓊斯教授展出了他上次考察中發現的所有物品。

sentences.english: A lot of precious historical relics are displayed in Xiangfan Museum.
sentences.chinese: 襄樊博物館展出了許多珍貴的歷史文物。

sentences.english: The ancient silk garments shown in the museums are above thousand years.
sentences.chinese: 博物館展出的古代絲綢服裝，已逾千百年。

sentences.english: The Craft Museum of Finland is a handicraft museum covering entire Finland.
sentences.chinese: 而手工藝博物館展出了芬蘭的所有手工藝。

sentences.english: The displayed models use 500 ccm ATV Motor which are already mass produced.
sentences.chinese: 展出的汽車模型，用500連鑄亞視目前已批量生產。

sentences.english: The Stillwater Giant is the first big exhibit I ever displayed.
sentences.chinese: 靜水巨人是我展出的第一個大件展覽品。

sentences.english: Mapplethorpe's photographs were first put on display in New York.
sentences.chinese: 梅普爾索普的照片首次在紐約展出。

sentences.english: On the floor below these aircraft are three spacecraft command ships.
sentences.chinese: 在這幾架飛機下面的地板上展出了三個航天器指令艙。

definition: to exhibit at or take part in a trade show etc
to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition
to reveal/to display/to show/to exhibit sth
to collect in a museum or library/museum collection/library holdings
